question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Allen and Bethany each arrive at a party at a random time between 1:00 and 2:00.  Each stays for 15 minutes, then leaves.  What is the probability that Allen and Bethany see each other at the party?
inference:
Allen arrives at time A, and Bethany arrives at time B.  Since A and B are both random times between 1:00 and 2:00, they are uniformly distributed on [1, 2].  The probability that they do not see each other is the probability that A + 0.25 < B or A > B + 0.25.  Since A and B are independent, this probability is:

$$\begin{split} P(A+0.25<B \text{ or } A>B+0.25) & = P(A+0.25<B) + P(A>B+0.25) \\\ & = \int_1^{1.75} \int_{x-0.25}^{x+0.25} 1 \text{ } dy \text{ } dx + \int_{1.75}^{2} \int_{x-0.25}^{x+0.25} 1 \text{ } dy \text{ } dx  \\\ & = \int_1^{1.75} (0.5) \text{ } dx + \int_{1.75}^{2} (0.5) \text{ } dx \\\ & = 0.375 + 0.125 \\\ & = 0.5 \end{split}$$

So, the probability that they do see each other is:

$$P(A+0.25<B \text{ or } A>B+0.25) = 1 - 0.5 = 0.5$$

**Final Answer: \boxed{0.5}. I hope it is correct.**

question:
Allen arrives at time A, and Bethany arrives at time B.  Since A and B are both random times between 1:00 and 2:00, they are uniformly distributed on [1, 2].  The probability that they do not see each other is the probability that A + 0.25 < B or A > B + 0.25.  Since A and B are independent, this probability is:

$$\begin{split} P(A+0.25<B \text{ or } A>B+0.25) & = P(A+0.25<B) + P(A>B+0.25) \\\ & = \int_1^{1.75} \int_{x-0.25}^{x+0.25} 1 \text{ } dy \text{ } dx + \int_{1.75}^{2} \int_{x-0.25}^{x+0.25} 1 \text{ } dy \text{ } dx  \\\ & = \int_1^{1.75} (0.5) \text{ } dx + \int_{1.75}^{2} (0.5) \text{ } dx \\\ & = 0.375 + 0.125 \\\ & = 0.5 \end{split}$$

So, the probability that they do see each other is:

$$P(A+0.25<B \text{ or } A>B+0.25) = 1 - 0.5 = 0.5$$

**Final Answer: \boxed{0.5}. I hope it is correct.**
